description: Ms. codex. Title from illuminated title page (fol. 1a). Incipit: سورة ال عمران مدنية قوله تعالى الم الله لا اله الّا هو قال الكلبى والوبيع بن آنس وغيرهما نزلت هذه الآيات Explicit: يومًا ترجعون فيه الى الله فعاش بعدها احد وعشرين يومًا والله سبحانه اعلم وصلى الله على سيدنا محمد النبى الامى وعلى آله وصحبه وسلّم Physical description: 19 lines per page. Written in round medium large naskh in black ink with use of red for commented text. The text is framed within a gilt frame outlined in black with blue outline on fol. 1b-2a. Cream paper with laid and chain lines visible (a few leaves darker) ; frame-ruled. Chiefly quinions. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a. Inscriptions on the doublure of the upper cover. Decoration: Illuminated title-page (ʻunwān), apparently left unfinished. Cartouche in gold, white, black, blue, and red, with title written in white on a gold and blue ground. Roundel in gold outlined in black on the left margin. Six lobed roundel in gold outlined in black encompassing a space left blank underneath the cartouche. The cartouche and roundels are outlined in blue ink. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the doublure of the upper cover: "Raqm 346". Collation: Paper, fol. 227 ; 1¹⁰ (-2, before fol. 1) 2-22¹⁰ 23¹⁰ (-1, end of quire) ; the quires are numbered using Arabic numerals. Origin: Collation statement dated last decade of Dhū al-Qaʻdah 854 [Dec. 1450] (margin of colophon, fol. 225b).
author: Baghawī, al-Ḥusayn ibn Masʻūd, -1117?
abstract: Second part of Baghawī's commentary of the Qurān, comprising the commentary of sūrat Āl ʻImrān and al-Nisāʼ (3-4). The text is followed by three reading statements on fol. 226a and short excerpts on fol. 226b.
alternative: ثاني من تفسير القرآن الكريم للامام العالم ابي محمد الحسين بن مسعود البغوي رحمه الله تعالى واثابه الجنة
extent: 227 leaves : paper ; 210 x 157 (150 x 115) mm. bound to 210 x 157 mm.
title: al-Thānī min Maʻālim al-tanzīl.
provenance: Waqf? statement, partly erased, in the name of Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Aḥmad ibn ʻUmar ibn Ismāʻīl ibn Aḥmad ibn al-shaykh Muḥyī al-Dīn ... ibn ...? Ibrāhīm ibn Adham (fol. 1a). Three reading statements on fol. 226a: 1) Reading and collating statement dated 17 Rabīʻ al-Ākhar 866? [Jan. 1462], written by Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad ibn Abī Bakr ibn Zayd, mentioning also al-Shaykh Jamāl al-Dīn al-faqīh al-fāḍil Abū al-maḥāsin Yūsuf ibn Muḥammad ibn ʻUmar al-Mardāwī thumma al-Dimashqī al-Ṣāliḥī al-Ḥanbalī (with note by a later hand on the margin about Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad) ; 2) reading statement mentioning the names of Shaykh ʻIzz al-Dīn Aḥmad ibn al-marḥūm qāḍī al-quḍāh Kamāl al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Jaʻfarī al-Nābulusī and ʻAbd Allāh ibn Shaykh Jamāl al-Dīn ʻAbd Allāh ibn Zayd al-..., signed ʻAlī ibn al-Bahā al-Baghdādī ; 3) reading statement dated 12 Ramaḍān 906 [April 1501] signed Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd al-Hādī.
creator: بغوي، الحسين بن مسعود
subject: Qurʼan—Commentaries—History—12th century—Sources
binding_note: Brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers. Both covers are similarly blind and gold-tooled with a central panel consisting of a six lobed roundel made of several intertwined fillets. The spaces between the fillets are filled with impressions of a small gold stamp (gold now almost completely wanting). The central panel is outlined by a frame of several fillets, with the inner corners outlined by similar fillets and filled with impressions of gold stamp (gold wanting). Outer border of fillets and a running pattern of impressions of a stamp with floral pattern. Embossed leather doublure. Traces of a now wanting fore-edge flap and envelope flap.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
